alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 7:37AM PST until January 13 at 11:20AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Stillaguamish River At Arlington affecting Snohomish County. .Heavy rain over the Central Cascades will come to an end this afternoon. The Stillaguamish River near Arlington will also crest this afternoon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillaguamish River At Arlington. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, the Stillaguamish River will cause flooding mainly in the Silvana area, along Norman Road and in Florence. A stage of 17 feet on the Stillaguamish River corresponds roughly to Phase 3 in the Snohomish County Flood program. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:10 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 15.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:10 AM PST Wednesday was 15.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.3 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 345 PM PST.
